HEADER.tool: A tool of the ecosystem from
HEADER.text: The Public Observatory of accessibility and usability practices on websites and mobile applications.

DROPDOWN.text: Sites and tools to support accessibility and usability, to ensure promotion good practices and improve the experience of using digital services.

accessibility.text: Dissemination, sharing and promotion of best accessibility practices for web content and mobile applications.
accessibility.link1: DL n.º 83/2018 - accessibility of the web and mobile applications

usability.text: Resources, tools and good practices to improve the usability and experience of using digital services.

badge.text: Seal of excellence that rewards good accessibility and usability practices on public service websites.

_1.title: What is the Observatory?
_1.paragraph: In an increasingly digital society, where online services are multiplying, the Portuguese Accessibility Observatory for websites and mobile applications emerges with the aim of:
_1.bullet1: Evaluate, identify and promote the application of best accessibility and usability practices on websites and mobile applications;
_1.bullet2: Monitor and present statistics on the level of accessibility and usability, in particular on public sector websites and mobile applications;
_1.bullet3: Generate everyone's awareness, support learning and alert public sector decision makers, contributing to more inclusive digital services and a better user experience.

_2.title: What do we evaluate?
_2.paragraph: We assess the accessibility and usability of websites and mobile applications, in particular public services, taking into account national and international guidelines, such as Decree-Law No. 83/2018, WCAG 2.1, from W3C, harmonized rules ACT Rules Community Group and Nielsen's heuristics, considering:
_2.bullet1: Analysis of HTML pages (HyperText Markup Language) and some elements in CSS (Cascading Style Sheet) existing online, according to the sample defined by law;
_2.bullet2: Prevalence of the Declaration of Accessibility and Usability and the Seal of Usability and Accessibility on websites and mobile applications;
_2.bullet3: Usability analysis using expert evaluation and tests with a pre-defined panel of citizens, which includes users with special needs.

_3.title: How do we evaluate?
_3.paragraph: Through a set of tools from the Digital Experience ecosystem, complemented by expert analyzes and tests with users, in accordance with national and international standards, guidelines and legislation, being that:
_3.bullet1: We evaluate automatically with the accessMonitor validator (battery of about 100 tests) and with the W3C HTML syntax validator, which analyzes each page and indicates the number of errors;
_3.bullet2: It aims to assess and make public sector websites and mobile applications more accessible to everyone and, in particular, people with disabilities.
_3.bullet3: We conduct usability tests with users, including citizens with special needs, and produce reports that identify corrections and improvements.

paragraph.part1: Did you know that any web user can, at any stage of their life, have degrees of impairment or visual, auditory, cognitive, physical or motor limitations?

MISC.unexpected_error: An unexpected error has ocurred. Please try again later.
MISC.error_contact: If the problem persists, please contact us...
MISC.directory_error: The directory you tried to access doesn't exist
MISC.website_error: The website you tried to access doesn't exist

_404.title: Error 404
_404.description: The page you tried to access doesn't exist.

messages.data_error: An error has ocurred while trying to retrieve user data
messages.data_table_error: An error has ocurred when trying to load the data table

ELEMS.aAdjacentSame: Adjacent links leading to the same destination
ELEMS.aImgAltNo: Links where the only content is an image with null alt or no caption
ELEMS.aSameText: Links with the same text that point to different destinations
ELEMS.aSkipFirst: Link to skip to main content
ELEMS.aTitleMatch: Links with the same text in content and title attribute
ELEMS.area: Active Zones of an Image Map
ELEMS.colorContrast: Color combinations with a contrast ratio less than 4.5:1 for regular text or 3:1 for large text
ELEMS.colorFgBgNo: CSS rules in which the background color and/or letter color are not specified simultaneously
ELEMS.fontAbsVal: Font sizes defined in absolute units of measure
ELEMS.fontHtml: Elements and Attributes (X) HTML to format the Text of pages (eg basefont, font, link, and alink)
ELEMS.frameDtdNo: Document frameset with incorrect or missing doctype
ELEMS.inputIdTitleNo: Form controls without label [label] associated and without the attribute title
ELEMS.inputLabel: Form controls that have explicitly associated a label (label)
ELEMS.inputLabelNo: Form controls without an accessible name
ELEMS.label: Elements label
ELEMS.layoutAttr: (X)HTML attributes to format page layout (eg align, hspace and bgcolor)
ELEMS.layoutElem: (X)HTML elements to format page layout (eg blink and center)
ELEMS.layoutFixed: Elements with absolute values in CSS property "width"
ELEMS.liNoList: List items used outside of lists
ELEMS.newWinOnLoad: New window once the page loads
ELEMS.tableCaptionSummary: Tables with the same text in the caption element and the summary attribute
ELEMS.tableComplexError: Complex data tables without the headers attribute in the data cells
ELEMS.tableDataCaption: Data tables without the caption element or the summary attribute
ELEMS.tableLayoutCaption: Tables without headers cells, but with the caption element or the summary
ELEMS.titleChars: Title with non-textual string (probably ASCII art)
ELEMS.titleLong: Number of characters in the title element
ELEMS.titleSame: Repeated page title on other pages of the site
ELEMS.valueAbsCss: Absolute units of measure in CSS
ELEMS.valueRelCss: Relative units of measure in CSS

RESULTS.a_01a: First link allows to skip to main content
RESULTS.a_01b: First link does not allow to skip to main content
RESULTS.a_02a: No links to skip text blocks
RESULTS.a_03: I found {{value}} links which content is empty. In fact, it is composed only by an image and that image has as alternative text equivalent an empty nature (i.e. alt=ʺʺ).
RESULTS.a_05: Title attribute of link element repeats text
RESULTS.a_06: Adjacent links pointing to same destination
RESULTS.a_09: Links with same text but different destinations
RESULTS.akey_01: Repeated values in the accesskey attributes
RESULTS.applet_01: applet elements without the alternative textual equivalent
RESULTS.area_01b: <area> elements without or empty alt attribute
RESULTS.blink_01: <blink> elements that cause shining of content parts
RESULTS.blink_02: <blink> values in CSS cause shinning of content parts
RESULTS.color_01: CSS rules that do not specify font color or background color
RESULTS.color_02: Color combinations with a contrast ratio less than 4.5:1 for regular text or 3:1 for large text
RESULTS.css_01: CSS specifies a spacing between lines lower than 1.5
RESULTS.dtd_01: Document Type Definition (DTD) does not exist
RESULTS.ehandler_01: Event manipulators that depend on mouse
RESULTS.ehandler_02: Redundant event manipulators are not used
RESULTS.ehandler_04: Event manipulators are associated with non-interactive elements
RESULTS.focus_01: Javascript is used to remove the focus from the field
RESULTS.font_01: HTML elements or attributes used to control the visual text presentation
RESULTS.font_02: Font size is expressed in absolute measure units
RESULTS.form_01a: All forms have a button to submit the data
RESULTS.form_01b: Forms without the button to submit the data
RESULTS.frame_01: Frames elements without or empty title attribute
RESULTS.frame_02: Webpage based on frame structure but with incorrect DTD declaration
RESULTS.hx_02: Headings whose content is only an image without alt attribute
RESULTS.hx_03: Hierarchical sequence of heading levels is violated
RESULTS.img_03: Images with an alt that doesn't serve as an alternative equivalent
RESULTS.img_04: Images with more than 100 characters in alt attribute
RESULTS.inp_img_01a: All graphic buttons make use of the alt attribute
RESULTS.input_01: Form control without the association of <label> element and without title attribute
RESULTS.input_02: Form control without an accessible name
RESULTS.input_02b: All form controls have an accessible name
RESULTS.input_03: <input> element that is not a graphical button with alt attribute
RESULTS.lang_02: Webpage main language is incorrectly marked
RESULTS.lang_04: lang and/or xml:lang attribute are being used in an incorrect way
RESULTS.lang_05: I observed that the document type does not allow the use of the {{value}} attribute.
RESULTS.layout_01a: No obsolete elements used to control the visual presentation
RESULTS.layout_01b: Obsolete element used to control the visual presentation
RESULTS.layout_02a: No obsolete attributes used to control the visual presentation
RESULTS.layout_02b: Obsolete attribute to control the visual presentation
RESULTS.layout_03: px measure unit is used in CSS
RESULTS.link_01: <link> elements that could serve to build a navigation system
RESULTS.list_01: List items marked out of the list
RESULTS.long_01: longdesc attribute in images with incorrect content
RESULTS.meta_01: Webpage restarts automatically with <meta http-equiv="refresh"> element
RESULTS.meta_02: Webpage is redirected automatically with <meta http-equiv="redirect"> element
RESULTS.scope_01: scope attribute from data table is invalid
RESULTS.table_01: Tables without identified heading but using <caption> and/or summary attribute
RESULTS.table_02: Data tables without <caption> element or summary attribute
RESULTS.table_06: Complex data tables with data cells without headers attribute
RESULTS.title_05: Webpage title seems to be ASCII-art
RESULTS.title_07: <title> equal to other webpages from the same website
RESULTS.w3c_validator_01a: W3C HTML validator with no errors
